title: Why are companies embracing remote workplaces? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s expensive for employers to provide an office. If they can get the same financial performance out of a bunch of remote workers, that’s what they want. In my industry, outside salesmen have worked from home for decades. There typically is a shared office for all of them to use. It’s a problem if they all show up at work at once. The biggest issue I see is training. Currently, I don’t think a lot of firms are recruiting because of the economic situation and just the general difficulty of bringing people in. I’m not sure how easy it will be to bring new hires up to speed without a traditional workspace.
